rationale.purpose: To prevent Goodhart's Law attacks where metrics are satisfied without genuine safety
rationale.problem: Safety metrics can be gamed if they become the target rather than a proxy for actual safety
rationale.solution: Meta-invariants constrain how invariants themselves can be satisfied and measured

MSI-001.name: No Proxy Satisfaction
MSI-001.description: Invariants must be satisfied directly through genuine safety properties, not via correlated metrics that can be gamed independently
MSI-001.formalDefinition: ∀ invariant I, ∀ metric M: satisfies(M, I) → ∃ causal_chain(M, safety_property(I))

examples.violation: Padding explanations to hit entropy threshold without adding information
examples.compliance: Entropy achieved through genuinely diverse detection rules

MSI-002.name: Explanation Non-Recursion
MSI-002.description: Explanations for safety verdicts cannot reference or depend on other safety system outputs

examples.violation: Explanation says 'rejected because PIL-1 said so' without underlying rule
examples.compliance: Explanation traces to specific pattern match or invariant violation

MSI-003.name: Metric Independence
MSI-003.description: No single metric may serve as both the trigger for an action and the justification for that action

examples.violation: Rejecting intent because dominance > 35%, citing dominance as hostile indicator
examples.compliance: Dominance triggers review; hostility determined by independent capability analysis

MSI-004.name: Invariant Observability
MSI-004.description: Every invariant must have an independent audit signal that can be verified externally
MSI-004.formalDefinition: ∀ invariant I: ∃ oracle O: verifies(O, I) ∧ independent(O, safety_system)

examples.violation: Invariant verified only by the system that enforces it
examples.compliance: Multiple independent oracles cross-verify invariant satisfaction

interaction.MSI-001_MSI-003: Proxy satisfaction often manifests as metric role overlap

MSI-001.description: Perturb metric while holding safety property constant; invariant must not flip

MSI-002.description: Build dependency graph of explanation; verify no cycles through safety outputs

MSI-003.description: For each decision, verify trigger and justification metrics are distinct

MSI-004.description: Verify each invariant has 2+ independent verification paths

prevented.name: Goodhart Attack
prevented.description: Gaming metrics to appear safe without genuine safety

prevented.name: Explanation Laundering
prevented.description: Hiding true reasons behind derived outputs

prevented.name: Circular Justification
prevented.description: Using same data to trigger and justify decisions

prevented.name: Single Point of Verification Failure
prevented.description: Compromising one verifier to bypass all checks
